description: The statue was unveiled by a far-left party, despite fierce objections from the city council.
title: Gelsenkirchen: Controversial Lenin statue erected in German city
title_page: Gelsenkirchen: Controversial Lenin statue erected in German city - BBC News
maintext: Lenin was a leader of the 1917 Russian Revolution and led the country until his death in 1924, when he was succeeded by Josef Stalin. However, he has remained a symbol of communism rule across the world, both among supporters and those who remember the human rights abuses that took place under the USSR.
